p: On the other hand, dynamic electron correlations in Refs. [ 85, 86, 87] predicted a decrease of the band gap to approximately 0.05 eV at low temperatures. In agreement with the experiment, these calculations showed further decrease of the band gap with the rise of temperature. According to Mazurenko et al. [ 85], the band gap disappeared at 386 K. These results suggest that, in FeSi, dynamic on-site correlations of Fe d-electrons are important for correct band structure description.
